ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Bizarre item on a merchant
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh heh, you can see the charges on the item even while the merchant has it. It only has one anyhow, but even having 1 Greater Heal handy for emergencies is a
ygData.messageBody:
Heh heh, you can see the charges on the item even while the merchant has it.
It only has one anyhow, but even having 1 Greater Heal handy for emergencies
is a nice boon for 2pp, especially since Light Heal potions cost 11pp and
are Lore. With my Squad Ring (Healing 1chg, rechargeable), Prayer Beads
(Healing 2chgs), and new Ring (Greater Healing 1chg) I have quite an arsenal
of emergency healing on hand. Thankfully the Ring and Prayer Beads are no
No Drop so I can move them to another character if necessary.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 12, 2000 4:53 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bizarre item on a merchant


At 04:29 PM 10/12/00 -0600, you wrote:
>Had a really weird thing happen the other night. I was running thru Qeynos
>looking for tailoring supplies and checking all the vendors. I found a HQ
>bear pelt which made me happy, but the merchant also had Mistmoore Drums
and
>a Blessed Ring of Nife. The Drums were way out of my price range, but I
>couldn't imagine why anyone would sell them to a merchant even if they were
>quitting their bard. The Ring of Nife is also very useful and was only 2pp
>or so. I can't wait to see the look on our cleric's face the next time he
>is OOM and we desperately need a Greater Heal.


Better pray that it isn't out of charges.

Talies
